requirements: Prerequisite: reading proficiency in ancient Hebrew. EMWAR area of concentration designations: STHJ, ScrInterp. The course also provides important historical context for students concentrating in Rabbinic Judaism.
description:
Study of the Damascus Document, one of the most important of the Dead Sea Scrolls. Attention to the documentâ€™s place in the history of biblical interpretation and ancient Jewish law; the nature and rhetorical function of its textual practices, both narrative and legal; and its relation to the central sectarian writings of the Qumran community.
